case_vignette: A 24-year-old man presents to the emergency department after a motor vehicle accident. He was the unrestrained driver in a head-on collision. The patient was ejected from the front seat and found by paramedics outside his car. In the trauma bay, the patient is started on IV fluids, blood products, and vasopressors. A FAST exam and chest radiograph are performed (Figure A), and multiple lacerations are repaired. After the initial resuscitation, his temperature is 98.4°F (36.9°C), blood pressure is 107/58 mmHg, pulse is 122/min, respirations are 22/min, and oxygen saturation is 98% on room air. The patient is conscious and complains of severe left shoulder pain and shortness of breath. He also vomits several times.
question: Which  is the most likely diagnosis?
